description: '''Solomon Popoli Linda''' (1909 â€“ 8 September 1962), also known as '''Solomon Ntsele''',{{Refn|''Linda'' was his [[Xhosa_clan_names|clan name]].<ref name="Gilmore">{{harvnb|Gilmore|2000}}</ref>|group=lower-alpha}} was a [[Music of South Africa|South African musician]], singer, and performer. He composed "[[The Lion Sleeps Tonight|Mbube]]", a defining South African song that revamped the [[isicathamiya]] genre and spawned a [[Mbube (genre)|distinct genre]] of [[Choir|choral]] music. "Mbube" would evolve into "The Lion Sleeps Tonight" when it was reimagined by [[the Tokens]] in 1961.
